overview_of_class: This course explores plate tectonics, the primary process driving Earth's evolution and functioning. which makes Earth different from neighboring planets. Topics include how plates move, how their boundaries operate, how these have changed over time, and the resulting natural hazards. Lab will involve learning to use software to describe present and past plate motions. GPLATES software will be downloaded onto students' computers at no cost.
name: Global Tectonics
title: WCAS EARTH 320-0-01 Global Tectonics

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Pre-requisites: Math 220 or 224, Physics 135-1 or equivalent, or permission of Instructor

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Two REQUIRED Textbooks:

1. An Introduction to Seismology, Earthquakes, and Earth Structure, Authors: Seth Stein, Michael Wysession, ISBN: 978-0-86542-078-6 (approx. $125 to buy, $95 to rent);

2. Earth History and Palaeogeography, Authors: Trond H. Torsvik, Robin M. Cocks, ISBN: 9781107105324 (approx. $75 to buy, $55 to rent).

Students will need their own laptops for this course.
